intro: Chaptalia integerrima, commonly known as the mountain chaptalia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with finely divided leaflets that give it a delicate appearance. Chaptalia integerrima is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
